text: in the second game para Yankee catcher
well he was always a hero to me because
as a boy growing up in New York he was
one of those Yankee greats that you
rooted for so to get to know him to get
to work with him was pure delight he
would call just to say what's new what
are you here what's the gossip any
rumors and I knew this was a regular guy
he was a product of the depression
immigrant parents from Italy he quit
school in eighth grade to help out with
the family income and his reading level
didn't advance much beyond comics books
which he was famous for reading he
became a beloved figure with the passage
of time he never got immediate respect
in any aspect of his life but his
ability to learn impart knowledge and
just go about his business in a workman
like manner makes him with Ruth Gehrig
dimaggio and mantle sort of the fifth
face on the Yankees Mount Rushmore
Oh
